p: Nsp3 is the largest element of the RTC. In addition to cleaving, Nsp3 alters cytokine expression to decrease the host innate immune response [ 10]. Nsp5 is a 3CLPro protease crucial for RNA replication. Nsp3, Nsp4, and Nsp6 form a complex to induce double-membrane vesicles [ 16]. Nsp7 and Nsp8 form an RNA polymerase complex performing de novo initiation and primer extension [ 17]. Nsp8 interacts with the replicase Nsp9 [ 18], and with the Orf6 accessory protein. In addition, four structural proteins: Spike (S), Envelope (E), Membrane (M), and Nucleocapsid (N) are encoded at the 3â€²-end. Eleven Orfs and 8 postulated accessory factors are also part of the virus structure.
